page.title: 09St Etheldreda's Church
page.content: Hyssington Church is dedicated to {St Etheldreda a Saxon Princess}who became an abbess. Although the first record of a church at the present site is 13th Century it is very likely that a church existed here in late Saxon times. The circular Churchyard could perhaps have been part of the{Motte {and Bailey castle}which overlooks the Church. The present building was restored in the 1890's. In 1985 the Electoral roll is 23. Collection in the last year amounted to Â£599. The parish is grouped with Churchstoke and our Vicar is also Vicar of Chuchstoke and Sarn.
